page.title: 14BENJAMIN BRITTEN HIGH SCHOOL
page.content: Benjamin Britten High School is the newest high school in Lowestoft.It was opened in 1978. It educates children from 13-18 years of age.It serves West Lowestoft and North Oulton Broad, and also the villages north of Lowestoft. There are 788 pupils. The headmistress, Miss G.Smith, believes that the school should be part of the community and pupils take part in activities involving the very young and old within Oulton area. The school offers a large range of subjects and activities. There are links for certain subjects with the College of Further Education. As a High School many pupils take external examinations and the school has a Leaving Certificate for non examination pupils. There is a House System and pupils are in tutorial groups.
